alert.note: Alert for Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 1:25PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following areas, in east central Georgia, Richmond. In central South Carolina, Aiken, Bamberg, Barnwell and Orangeburg. * WHEN...Until 330 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 121 PM EDT, Doppler radar and a spotter have indicated heavy rain. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen so far between Aiken and New Ellenton. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area, especially in Barnwell County. This additional rain could result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aiken, Barnwell, Denmark, Savannah River Site, Aiken Mall, Williston, Blackville, New Ellenton, Jackson, Aiken State Park, Barnwell State Park, Citizens Park, Gloverville, Augusta Regional Airport, Burnettown, Springfield, Hilda, Snelling and Olar. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 10 and 14. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
